022
023package org.opt4j.operators.crossover;
024
025import java.util.Random;
026
027import org.opt4j.core.common.random.Rand;
028import org.opt4j.core.genotype.ListGenotype;
029
030import com.google.inject.Inject;
031
032/**
033 * <p>
034 * The {@link CrossoverListRate} performs a crossover on
035 * {@link org.opt4j.core.Genotype} objects that are lists of values.
036 * </p>
037 * <p>
038 * A point of crossover of the list is selected with a given {@code rate}.
039 * </p>
040 * 
041 * @author lukasiewycz
042 * 
043 */
044public abstract class CrossoverListRate<G extends ListGenotype<?>> implements Crossover<G> {
045
046        protected final Random random;
047
048        protected final double rate;
049
050        /**
051         * Constructs a new {@link CrossoverListRate}.
052         * 
053         * @param rate
054         *            the rate for a crossover
055         * @param random
056         *            the random number generator
057         */
058        @Inject
059        public CrossoverListRate(double rate, Rand random) {
060                this.rate = rate;
061                this.random = random;
062        }
063
064        /*
065         * (non-Javadoc)
066         * 
067         * @see
068         * org.opt4j.operator.crossover.Crossover#crossover(org.opt4j.core.Genotype,
069         * org.opt4j.core.Genotype)
070         */
071        @Override
072        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
073        public Pair<G> crossover(G p1, G p2) {
074
075                ListGenotype<Object> o1 = p1.newInstance();
076                ListGenotype<Object> o2 = p2.newInstance();
077
078                int size = p1.size();
079
080                boolean select = random.nextBoolean();
081
082                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
083                        if (random.nextDouble() < rate) {
084                                select = !select;
085                        }
086
087                        if (select) {
088                                o1.add(p1.get(i));
089                                o2.add(p2.get(i));
090                        } else {
091                                o1.add(p2.get(i));
092                                o2.add(p1.get(i));
093                        }
094                }
095
096                Pair<G> offspring = new Pair<>((G) o1, (G) o2);
097                return offspring;
098        }
099
100}
